learning_outcomes: Describe a set by listing its members.
Recognise and use the symbols "=" equal to, "≠" not equal to.
Read and write numbers up to 1 000 000.
Express a number in expanded notation.
Add whole numbers with sums up to 100 000.
Carry out addition of numbers in real life situations.
Subtract whole numbers up to 100 000.
Carry out subtraction and addition in real life situation.
Multiply two and three digit numbers by a single digit number vertically.
Apply multiplication in real life situation.
Divide two and three digit numbers by single digit number using Long division (with remainders).
Demonstrate multiplication and division skills in real life situations.
Order numbers using mathematical symbols ">", "<", "=" and "≠".
Identify and represent proper fractions as equal parts of a whole.
Draw and shade proper fractions.
Add and subtract proper fractions with common denominator.
Apply proper fractions in real life situations.
Tell time at specified intervals.
Read and use the calendar.
Describe the unit for measuring long distances (Km).
Describe mass and the standard units for its measure.
Describe capacity and the standard units for its measure.
Collect and present ungrouped data on a frequency table.
Draw Arrow diagrams to illustrate one-to-one mappings.
Identify right angled triangle by folding rectangular and squared paper.
Draw right angled triangle on squared paper.
